trans-unit.target: TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_SEQ_00<tab>Moegramm has been losing sleep over his sheep.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_SEQ_01<tab>The wool from Moegramm's sheep lacks its former luster, and won't fetch a fair price at market. The shepherd Chartain should know how to make the sheep shine again.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_SEQ_02<tab>Chartain attributes the lackluster fleece to lice, and attributes the lice to a lack of farmhands to help with brushing. Delouse three shaggy sheep with the lice comb.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_SEQ_03<tab>Inform Moegramm that his shaggy sheep now have a sheepy sheen.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_SEQ_04<tab>Moegramm is grateful you brushed up his wool for market. It would have been a shame to make mutton of the sheep when he seems so...attached.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Chartain.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_TODO_01<tab>Use the lice comb on the shaggy sheep.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_TODO_02<tab>Report to Moegramm.

TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_MOEGRAMM_000_0<tab>They call me the Stead shepherd, but all three kinds of livestock we breed here fall under my crook. Nevertheless, sheep remain my first love, my one true passion.

TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_MOEGRAMM_000_1<tab>So you can imagine my dismay at finding my flock in frumpy fleece! I can't very well take worn-out wool to market. A sheep with no shine is good for nothing but mutton!
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_MOEGRAMM_000_2<tab>But where there's wool, there's a way! See what Chartain has to say.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_CHARTAIN_000_10<tab>Moegramm had some little lambs whose fleece was white as snow. But everywhere the little lambs went, lice were sure to go. Now we're stuck with lousy sheep.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_CHARTAIN_000_11<tab>In the time it takes me to brush one clean, the lice spread to two more. I just can't keep up with them by myself!
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_CHARTAIN_000_12<tab>If you could brush three shaggy sheep for me, we might be able to wipe out the infestation altogether.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_CHARTAIN_000_13<tab>Let Moegramm know his sheep are in shipshape once you've finished.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_SYSTEM_000_20<tab>The shaggy sheep looks itchy.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_SYSTEM_000_21<tab>The shaggy sheep looks relieved.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_SYSTEM_000_22<tab>The shaggy sheep looks relieved.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_MOEGRAMM_000_30<tab>For an adventurer, you certainly know how to wield a lice comb!
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_MOEGRAMM_000_31<tab>As I'm sure you have found, sheep are delicate souls that require delicate care. Truly wonderful wool requires time, love, and tenderness.
TEXT_SUBSEA069_00481_MOEGRAMM_000_32<tab>You must caress their coats ever so gently, listen to their soft bleating in your ear, feel the warmth of their breath on your neck...
